title: Chav
summary: "Chav" (/tʃæv/), also "charver" and "scally" in parts of England is a British pejorative term used to describe an anti-social lower-class youth dressed in sportswear.[1] "Chavette" is a related term referring to female chavs, and the adjectives "chavvy", "chavvish", and "chavtastic"  are used to describe things associated with chavs, such as fashion, slang, etc.[2] In Ireland, "skanger" is used in a similar manner.[3]
